Reviews.Title: “Tranquil escape from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: asha086
Reviews.Content: Situated in the Parioli district, Hotel Villa Duse is 15mins on the 360 bus to Termini Stazionie. We did not find this too much of an inconvenience as we accepted the trade off between proximity to the center and the peace and quiet which we had at the hotel.Call reception and they will check on line and let you know in real time when the next bus is due! The hotel is really comfortable and clean and oozes Italian charm. There is free wi-fi in the rooms. The staff are all well trained and the front desk staff incredibly helpful and accomodating. Breakfast is really good, there is an a la carte menu for eggs etc if you do not want the carb fest of cakes, fruit, cereal, bread rolls and croissants (there is ham, salami, cheese and yogurt as protein options) which make up the buffet breakfast. Just be aware that if breakfast is included in the room rate it refers to the buffet not the a la carte options. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Duse a luxury bargain”
Reviews.Author: richard c
Reviews.Content: First rate intimate and luxury hotel with amazing baroque ambience and quiet residential location within walking distance from city or 360 bus route from Stazione Terminale

Reviews.Title: “Just great, great, great and well, great!”
Reviews.Author: shinjodenn
Reviews.Content: OK. So this is NOT your Rome city center hotel. It is a http://www.charmerelax.com/ recommended hotel and that already says allot. Service. We went here to celebrate my wife's birthday. In my reservation, done on booking.com, I asked for some recommendations for restaurants and I asked them if there was anything that they could do to help me make the stay special. In less than 1 hour after I made the reservation I got a list of restaurants with links to their webpage and distance from the hotel indicated and their judgment of the restaurants. As for the something special they also gave me some options. I picked the champagne and fresh fruit. As for the restaurant I reserved a table at All'Oro a gourmet restaurant (Michelin 1 star) indicated in their list of restaurants. Great. We get there and the room is great and there is the champagne and fruit laid out. The front desk staff proceed to call up the restaurant to remind them that my wife is pregnant and to make sure that the menu will not include things that she cannot eat. They also move the reservation back 1/2 hour. Great. Location. Quiet serene hotel in the wonderful residential area of Parioli. With our restaurant literally 2 minutes walking distance from the hotel and our ability to park the car basically in front of the hotel what can I say but ... Great. Room. The room is wonderful and quiet and the bed/pillows are super comfy. The bathroom is large and the bathtub is just waiting for a bubble bath. Great. Breakfast. The breakfast in the morning is not too much and not too little - just right. There are fresh cakes (about 6) and fresh croissants as well as a quiche and some sliced deli meets, juice, yogurts, cereals and a fresh fruit salad. Great.

Reviews.Title: “Real Roman Highlight”
Reviews.Author: loulee1
Reviews.Content: Just back from spending a brilliant 5 days in Rome and I've got to say the hotel villa duse played a big part. Everything about the hotel was excellent but a special mention must be paid to the staff. I've never met as friendly and helpful a team as this. Nothing was ever too much trouble and they were always on hand with advice. The tower lodge was a beautiful room and the balcony was perfect to relax in the sun or for a quiet romantic dinner in. The meal we got was also excellent, beautifully presented and great value vs what we recieved in town. It is a bit outside the centre but that just means you get peace and quiet in a very safe neighbourhood. The walk to town wasn't bad as the villa borghese is a beautiful park to walk through and its really easy to find. I really would recommend this hotel as my fiancee and I thought it was perfect and again I can't speak highly enough of the fantastic people who work hard to make it so. Thanks for a helping make it a wonderful experience for us both.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Craig A
Reviews.Content: I'm new to tripadvisor but wanted to write a review about the hotel even thought I spent my honeymoon there last May 2011. The Hotel was fantastic starting with the staff who were extremely helpful from the minute we arrived. As for the rooms they lived up to all the pictures we had seen and the beds were ridiculously comfy, the bathroom had a powerful shower and a nice big tub to soak in. The one thing about this hotel is it is a little out the way but I would not let this put you off as it is only a short bus ride or if like me and my wife you like to walk, it is nice to walk through the park each day to the Spanish steps (helps to account for all the wonderful food Rome has to offer)

Reviews.Title: “Serene accommodations off the beaten track.”
Reviews.Author: loveinmytummy
Reviews.Content: A serene and gracious hotel in Parioli, a fine residential area in Rome. Excellent local restaurants serve discriminating Italians. Staff are service oriented. Our room was large and comfortable. True, it's a bit of a trek from the sights, but that's the price to pay for calm and seclusion.

Reviews.Title: “Classy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: brattebo
Reviews.Content: This is a special, tasteful boutique hotel. On recent trip to Rome, I stayed 4nights in central Rome and 3 nights at Villa Duse. Both were excellent but the winner was Villa Duse. Location was no drawback as bus line was right outside the hotel and 20 minute commute to Termini station. After Central Rome, I enjoyed the quieter Parioli area and adjacent Quartier Coppeda area with easy access to Borghese park. Hotel had great breakfast, warm & well trained employees and special design touches throughout the hotel and in the outdoor courtyard. It was evident to me the owner has great pride in this hotel and we look forward to a return visit. Nearby All'Ora restaurant is a one star Michelin restaurant not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice private garden”
Reviews.Author: Travis A
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were very well functional and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. Breakfast was poor. Location was not central. But I generally liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: RHKRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: Villa Duse is a perfect place for a couple for those who desire staying in a trendy but off center Rome neighbour. Rooms, staff and arquitecture was perfect for me and my wife.

Reviews.Title: “quite and very cute”
Reviews.Author: katerina3633
Reviews.Content: We like this hotel very much, we were reserved standart but a staff of a hotel offered us a big one room, the bath is very clean with marvle carrara inside. The breakfest only not very full...but was enough, and also sweet present from a hotel for a christmas. And also the staff is very helpful, can decided all your needs. We were travelled by car, and realy one proble is to find parking...but finaly we decided to park in front of hotel....but was a bit scaring about fire of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: exurbia
Reviews.Content: This is a small charming hotel in a lovely, quiet neighborhood. It's away from the city center so one does get to experience Rome from a non-touristy perspective. I"m sure Irena at the front desk will remember us. I broke my foot our first day in Rome. Irena was so very helpful. She called a nearby medical clinic and got me an appt. with an orthopedic doctor. Since it was only a few short blocks away she insisted on taking us there in her own car. I just can't say enough about how nice and helpful all the staff were to us. Loved the hotel, loved the neighborhood and loved everyone working at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jiminhawaii808
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Duse is a true Rome experience; however, before you book, do decide if you are going to Rome to see absolutely everything possible in the least amount of time, or if you want to experience real life Rome. Villa Duse is not in the standard tourist zone, so one must use public transportation which functions exceptionally well and will get to every tourist district. However, do expect to walk in a friendly, upscale neighborhood that provides all the amenities that those that live and work there actually need and use. The Hotel Villa Duse is the bonus. The small competent staff will exceed your expectations, and the Pastry Chef will have morning surprises that will not disappoint your palate. As an exceptionally renovated private villa, the attention to detail from the high ceilings, massive windows, beckoning bathroom, and quiet walled courtyard complete with water fountains, wine service, and wifi will have you gladly extending your original stay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: VenessaT
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience from the moment we set foot into the lobby on our first day. The hotel is small - about 16 rooms or so in a previously owned private home, now converted. This allows for each guest to get personal service: the reception staff were extremely helpful with great suggestions for nearby restaurants, help with getting around, and little details. The service staff were great, including the porters, servers, and housekeeping. Everyone was extremely courteous. Daily breakfast in the hotel was lovely and always a great start to the day. The hotel is located on the outskirts of the city center - upscale and safe, but always a bus ride away from any of the major tourist sites. This was maybe the only downside; however, well worth it. This is a great hotel for anyone who may have already visited Rome and is not preoccupied with seeing all the sights, but rather looking to have a relaxing vacation. We loved it here and will almost certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection Away From the Crowd”
Reviews.Author: AMG Travel s
Reviews.Content: Located in an upscale, safe neighborhood of Rome. It is a 10euro, 10 minute ride into city center. Taxis always arrived within ten minutes of our request. The distance did not bother us at all. There are about 4-5 cafe's located less than a 1 minute walk from the hotel..most have staff that speak English and stay open until midnight for quick bites. The room was very clean with a comfortable bed and a powerful hairdryer (not the typical european wall mount.) The free breakfast had a wide selection of meats, breads and cereals, all fresh. This is an urban but not touristy area (similar to the Upper East Side of New York.) One of our driver's questioned how we found this part of Rome and the hotel..."because this is really nice most American's don't know about it." Not sure if I should have been offened but I took it as a compliment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for honeymooners / couples”
Reviews.Author: laurangelus
Reviews.Content: We were staying in another hotel when we saw Hotel Villa Duse on tripadvisor and decided to try. The hotel is located in Parioli area, where you can experience real Roman life (nice, clean, high-end suburbs). The hotel is not in the city center, yet I would prefer a quiet, nice and "local" location anyway. We walked to Collosseum one day, visiting Borghese gardens and walking down Via Veneto. Thanks to GPS, we never got lost and had a wonderful walking trip. Even some reviewers say it is far to the city center, we found it pretty close - walking distance to Villa Borghese, Via Veneto and Trevi Fountain. We stayed at Tower Lodge room, which has a private access with elevator. The room is definitely incredible. Classic furniture with a modern touch of technology, comfiest bed ever... And a private terrace... The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. We will definitely come again

Reviews.Title: “Not go there”
Reviews.Author: van v
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is the smallest of my italy trip. The location is far away form the centre and all the attractive points. Only a bus - No.360 from Termini to the hotel and it takes 25 mins to go there. The room, the bed and the bathroom are all extreme small I selected to include breakfast by paying more but what a pretty the hot food is not included. We need to pay extra for eggs and toast. I stayed 4 nights and ate their cakes and corn flake for 4 days Only 1 staff serve during the whole breakfast time and we need to wait for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Marcpc
Reviews.Content: The reason I put the word "nearly" rather than "perfect" in the description has nothing to do with the hotel, as such. Well, ok, it does have something to do with the hotel. There is something missing in the hotel. But it isn't a bad thing or something that's not a reason for staying here. Just something that would make it amazing rather than great, which it is. But first, the hotel is in Parioli, a quiet and pleasant well to do suburb of Rome with some excellent restaurants cafes and a small market nearby (we The nearby Taverna Rossini - about 5-10 minutes walk - is really nice). You can walk into town by day (about 30 minutes gets you to Piazza del Popolo and its a nice walk through the Park Villa Borghese. Or you can get a bus (the number 52 leaves from nearby) Now the hotel: It's clean, modern with beautiful rooms at a reasonable price for Rome. We stayed here to save money as the hotels in the centre are expensive. Breakfasts are nice (a shame that they have them in the basement rather than in the garden, but I guess that's logistics). The ambience of the hotel is cosy and friendly with very nice staff who looked after us well. The decor everywhere is beautiful. The building is lovely with a lovely garden where you can sit outside and have a drink. The area is also nice. Now that minor thing that would make it perfect: There is a raised platform out in the garden which would make a perfect place to have a little swimming pool. For northern Europeans Rome weather is suitable to swim right up to early November with temperatures of over 20 degrees by day. From April to November this would make this hotel a great place to lounge around, rather than just visit. That's just a thought. Otherwise I really recommend Villa Duse for (for Rome) reasonable prices and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: drimbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Villa Duse for five nights recently. We have been to Rome and Italy many times and this hotel was excellent in terms of room size and cleanliness. We chose it because of previous reviews which were very positive. Our view is a little more balanced. The breakfast is pretty basic even by continental standards. The staff were generally helpful. The only sour note was that we were told still water in the fridge was complimentary, however when we asked for it to be replenished we were told there was only one per visit. We are talking here about a 0.5 litre of still water!!! This seems petty in the extreme. Also while the location of the hotel was good be prepared to walk 10 or 15 minutes to the bus. There are really no nearby attractions apart from Catacomb Priscilla which is a 25 minute tour. We ate in Ciccia Bomba ai Parioli, only a five minute walk from the hotel and this was a truly excellent dining experience. Although not recommended by the hotel, it was the highlight of our dining experience in Rome. We also ate in All'oro and while the food was exquisite and inventive, the portions were extremely small even by Michelin star standards.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim A
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough great things about this hotel! After spending each day out in the touristy parts of Rome, it was great to come back to a quiet and peaceful hotel away from all the hustle and bustle. Room was very clean and elegant, breakfast delicious, and the staff very friendly. Upon our arrival in Rome, we realized we had left one of our cameras on the train, which was bound for Florence then Milan. After several failed attempts to phone someone ourselves during our bus ride to the hotel we told Irene, the lady working the front desk, about our plight. She went above and beyond her duty to make several calls, including to the Milan train station police, who ultimately recovered our camera, which allowed us to retreive it during our already-planned stop in Milan a week later. We are so grateful to Irene at Villa Duse and everyone else who were involved to get our camera back. If you're looking for a great hotel outside the more touristy parts of Rome, Villa Duse is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “It would be just perfect if the bus service was frequent”
Reviews.Author: SbTravellerThes
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, located at a quite neighborhood in Parioli area. The room was very cosy, yet spacious. The breakfast was really good, with a great variety of home-made cakes and great coffee. The hotel staff was professional and helpful, as it should be. In a 10min walk distance, one can find several dining options. We tried a couple of restaurants and they were great. The only downside was the transportation to the city center. The area is served by the bus route 360, whose station is 2min walk distance from the hotel. However, you will be lucky if you wait less than 15 minutes, in both directions. I would say that in a 5-days stay we waited an average of 25minutes to get towards the city centre and another 25minutes to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Karin181
Reviews.Content: very beautiful boutique hotel, excellent service, very friendly and helpful staff. breakfast delicious. some might say, it's little far out, but we enjoyed the peaceful area very much after the busy days in the center. bus stop around the corner and tram stop a 10 min walk away. taxi from the city was 10-15€ when we were lazy late at night... coffee bar and deli/bakery around the corner to get water and snacks. We'll plant one of the beautiful Corbezzolo bushes they have in our garden in sping - thank you for the gardening advice :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for a relaxing stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Laura D
Reviews.Content: Given what I have heard about hotels in Rome - rooms are small and staff unfriendly - the Villa Duse must be the exception that proves the rule. Every member of staff had a smile and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were big and airy, bed comfortable and everything spotlessly clean. Most unusually for Rome it was also wonderfully quiet - perfect for catching up on sleep so you have the energy for the days of sightseeing. The hotel is a little way out of the centre but a 20 minute tram ride gets you right to the Vatican and once you have worked out the buses you can get around very quickly and easily and it gives you a chance to see different parts of Rome other than the touristic centre. The hotel also runs a brilliant shuttle service to a fantastic local restaurant, (Restaurant d'Abruzzo) that served up tasty rustic italian food in a warm and friendly atmosphere. I cannot recommend it more highly - if you dont mind being a little further out of the centre you can''t go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgieyoung
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our 15th and can't say enough about this hotel. The rooms are large with a fully stocked (and reasonably priced) mini bar. Breakfast was included in the rate which is also a huge plus. If you happen to miss breakfast there is a cafe around the corner and a few good restaurants for dinner just a 10 minute walk away. Other reviews indicated that the location is a bit out of the way but we found it to be perfect because the staff will call a cab for you to take you into the tourist areas. It's about 17 euros to the Vatican and about 10 euros to the main terminal. Since there isn't a "central location" in Rome this hotel is perfect because it allows you to retreat to a quiet neighborhood in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful Staff, bus on doorstep takes you everywhere”
Reviews.Author: tambyistherajah
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are a very generous size, breakfast is delicious even a range of cakes! Decor is grand and bus around the corner from hotel takes you straight from the train terminal to the front of the hotel. Staff are very helpful and you must try a little restaurant around the corner called Ciccia Bomba ai Paroli Osteria via R.Fauro,2 tel 06.80692020 we ate here every night and the food was the BEST I had on our whole European holiday, it was very reasonably priced if not cheap. We ate 3 courses each and 1 Litre of wine cost AU$60, it is just a short walk from this hotel. This hotel was in a quiet peaceful location- you felt like a local. I will stay at this hotel again next time I visit Rome, highly reccommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay at a special place.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsueToronto
Reviews.Content: Villa Duse is located in the Parioli district away from the tourist centre of Rome. However, a short taxi ride or transit service will get you there. It is a relaxing, artistic boutique hotel where you immediately feel the relaxing and restful atmosphere upon arrival. The staff is most helpful- they confirmed air return trip, ordered taxis and driver to the airport for us. They also arranged for us to have a delightful traditional Italian dinner with free shuttle service. The room was a good size for a boutique hotel with a large washroom. We spent some time in the beautiful garden a perfect spot is sit and read your favourite book. The decorations in the hotel were tastefully done. All in all a wonderful place to stay and one that we definitely will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded even our highest expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Drising
Reviews.Content: What a terrific property to end 2 weeks in Italy. I carefully researched every possible option in Rome and was convinced the Villa Duse would be a perfect retreat and respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. A 10 euro cab ride to the Spanish steps is a more than fair trade for such lovely accommodations and personable staff. We will return here without a second thought!

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel”
Reviews.Author: klon
Reviews.Content: Went here for Silver Wedding Anniversary. The staff were very attentive and booked restaurants, recommended places to visit and generally made us feel really pampered. Although the hotel is not in the centre it is on a bus line and a taxi is about 10 to 15 euros into the centre. I recommend for couples looking for a relaxing end to a busy day sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the city buzz, perfect for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: bncav
Reviews.Content: The Villa Duse Hotel can be qualified as a boutique hotel, given its exclusive service, location and design. It makes the hotel a very good choice for people who want to be away from the center of Rome and demand a good room, service and breakfast, in a quiet neighborhood. The area (Parioli) is one of the most high-end ones in Rome, with a number of good restaurants (almost no tourists) and very safe. It takes about 15 minutes by bus (#52) plus 15 minutes walking to get to the hotel, leaving from the center of the city, or a 10 minutes cab ride from Termini (about 12 Euros). The only downside (despite the distance, which was not a problem for us), is the wi-fi internet service. We were able to get maybe 20 minutes of good signal during our stay and they MUST correct this, since it is very annoying. In general a very good stay with a correct price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scooney1967
Reviews.Content: Ok, thought I'd write a review on this hotel - because it deserves it. Just stayed 3 nights at the Villa Duse earlier this week, and had a great time. The hotel is out of the main centre, but a 360 bus 10 metres away takes you to Termini central station for €1! (Suggest you buy a €4 day card - gets you on all busses and metro, and gets you €2 off the open-top sight-seeing bus if you fancy doing that - which I recommentd. 2 days for €18 if you use the discount. It is worth it. Anyway, so the hotel is far out enough to be lovely and quiet and peaceful (perfect for a whole night's sleep) but handy enough to be in the centre within 20 mins. We got lucky with the room - free upgrade to the excellent red junior suite - complete with balcony. Awesome. Everything was clean - the bed was 10/10 - the room was stylish - the aircon worked perfectly - tv great - minibar (which can act as a fridge if you're watching the pennies.....) Great sleeps, which is priceless in big cities - gives you the energy to do the sights and really enjoy it. Breakfast was very good - a good mix of healthy and cakes if you want to indulge. The fruit was very fresh and everything was in plentiful supply. Breakfast was served 7.30 - 10.30am - so we bombed down at 10am each morning, due to late nights!!! For me the staff were tremendous, and one of the reasons the hotel has so much appeal. I stay in hotels maybe 4 times a month with work, and I normally really don't like them - this one is different - it's a bit like staying in someone's house. I have to mention Daniel, who was an excellent guy, and a real credit to the hotel. OWNER/MANAGER, if you are reading this, please note!!! He was very helpful, well mannered and very professional. Anyway, I think that's all I want to say - if you have specific questions, I would be happy to reply - suggest you get a late cab to the Ponte Milvio - it's not cheap at €16 but worth it. We went twice out of 3 nights. Absolutely jumping with under 40-year olds. Great restos and great bars - not rowdy, mostly couples, and everyone just seemed in a great mood. The restos were pretty cheap, so took the pain out of the cab fares there and back. The quality of the food we got was first rate. Enjoy - am jealous writing this thinking you might be going and I AM BACK TO BLOODY WORK ON MONDAY!!!! haha. cheers - Paul

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: pitmanos
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a nice, clean, quiet hotel but this small jewel offered us a lot more. At a quiet area of Rome, a bit far from the noisy centre, but not remote. The room was perfect. Quality of services is excellent. Trust the personnel for tips and hints around the city. In conclusion, made us feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “A beautifully appointed oasis that felt like our home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gelatifan
Reviews.Content: This enchanting little place on a leafy side street has everything we craved after another hot day on the overcrowded tourist trail--comfy beds, an up-to-the-minute shower, an enveloping sense of calm and helpful staff for whom "Welcome back" is not just an empty ritual. We booked the Library Suite, which has a comfortable couch for reading and, unlike most hotel rooms, has plenty of good light. The window treatments are an insomniac's fantasy: automatic blackout blinds keep out every ray of light. Another bonus: free WiFi. As everyone else has noted, this hotel is a bus ride away from the centre of things (ask the concierge when the next one is due, so you won't waste time at the stop). If you need to freshen up between sightseeing tours, stay elsewhere. But if you'd rather stay in a comfortable Roman neighbourhood, where the people you'll see in local trattorias are mostly local residents, Villa Duse will soon feel like home. Let the staff steer you to one of many appealing restaurants within walking distance. Don't miss La Pariolina, a hopping place where both the welcome and the food have lots of heart.

Reviews.Title: “Our expectations were met!”
Reviews.Author: Flamencogirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a five-day break on the basis of other reviews and they are right! It is a lovely little hotel - very tastefully furnished/decorated, very comfortable beds, great power shower and friendly staff. The buffet breakfast included in our price was fine with all the usual things - juices, yoghurt, cereals, rolls, ham, cheese, pastries - cooked food extra. The only problem might be the location for some people. If you want to be in centre of town, then this hotel is not for you. However, the 360 bus takes you right outside the hotel and is a frequent service so we didn't mind. It is also situated in a quiet street if you want peace and quiet. Having said that, my first night was disturbed by the people of the apartment next door having a party till 1 am, however, this was only because of the next day's 150th Anniversary of the Republic celebrations and it was quiet thereafter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Stevd1712
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for two nights. Room was stunning, the best I have ever stayed in and so perfect for a romantic weekend. Staff are so helpful, especially man on reception. Location is not perfect but fine. If you get use to the bus it's ten minutes from everything and bus is every ten minutes so no issues and for the room it's worth it......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cagioiosa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a flying visit to Rome. I did a great deal of research before booking the Hotel Villa Duse as I am very hard to please when it comes to hotels perhaps because I am in the hospitality business myself.May I say that hotel Villa Duse ticks all my boxes! The hotel is situated in a very quiet residential area of Rome called Parioli. We took a no. 360 bus from the Termini train station which dropped us off almost outside Villa Duse which was very convenient and only cost 1 euro per ticket! The hotel is a beautifully converted private villa and every attention has been made to detail. Elegant but also very comfortable, we had booked the least expensive room ( they only have a dozen or so all together ) which was no.3 and had it's own tiny private patio where we sat enjoyed the warm Spring evening. The bathroom eas well equipped with luxury large towels, robes and slippers and was a good size with a real window that you could open! The bedroom was medium sized decorated with taste and beautiful fabrics. The bed was large and comfortable. There was a awell stocked mini bar, reasonabily priced and a flat screen TV. Breakfast was served in the garden and consisted of wonderful home made cakes, puddings and pies ( an Italian breakfast tradition ) but also frsh fruit salad, yoghurt, cereals, croissants, rolls and preserves. There was a small selection of ham and cheese too. The cappucino was very good and the waiter extremely pleasant. Just before I finish a special mention for Abel on the front desk who was very kind and helpful and also to Irene who put up with my frequent emails prior to our stay. Top marks for Hotel Villa Duse and it's staff! I can't wait to return...

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveBergkamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Duse over the easter weekend and had a lovely time - the staff are super friendly and helped us book restaurant reservations as well as helped with travel around the city. Nice modern touches in the room and bathroom didnt spoil the classic simple look of the room. All in all very nice indeed. The only bad side was the location, which is a 5 minute walk from the nearest bus / tram, which themselves take 10 / 15 minutes to get to the centre. But still, you do a lot of walking in Rome, so a bit extra isn't really an issue, and it also means that it is a quiet location. Also, bizarrely, my book got stolen from my room on the last day?! Can only assume the cleaners picked it up off the bed with the sheets by accident... Anyway, very annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel in the suburb”
Reviews.Author: a_o_traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a Park Suite for a short break. The room was on the ground floor, beautifully furnished and had its own little garden. After each day in the hectic city centre, we really appreciated the quiet of our room, with a very comfortable bed, satellite TV and power shower. However, the hotel is a little far from the city centre. It took us 30-40 minutes every time we went anywhere. We quite enjoyed the journeys in spring sunshine, but next time may try to stay within walking distance to the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely mansion out of the busy area”
Reviews.Author: vsilva
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our family of five and decided to stay out of the turistic areas to savor a bit of the true roman experience and that was what we got! In a residencial suburb of Rome a lovely 200 year old mansion, newly remodeled and with a romantic flair,we enjoyed every minute! The rooms where very comfortable and bathrooms had all the usual amenities. The windows had an electric blind that came down to shut out all the morning light, wich the kids thought to be awsome! Staff was very helpful and suggested a number of good restaurants near by. We had breakfast included in our rate and the selection of choices was good, with delicious cakes made fresh every morning. Yes it is far out the major attractions and a cab is the best way to get around, even though we did walk 10 minutes to get to the bus stop and other restaurants. But if it's quality and something extra you're looking for, than this is the right place.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL - touch out of the way”
Reviews.Author: SKate82
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here over valentines. The hotel is small, but decent sized rooms and beautiful decor. The beds are amazingly comfortable and they have electronic blackout bindes. They have a well stocked mini bar and the wine in the room is delicious. The flat screen sky TV is a bonus, as is the decent shower, bath and hair-dryer is included. Big towels & bath robes are another plus. In Italy it's apparnently illegal to supply/lend irons by the hotel (or at least this is what we were advised by the staff) so gentleman, take a travel one if needed. The cold breakfast was really good too, beautiful/cozy dining area with plenty of cold food available, fruit, yogurt, cereal, cakes, and pastries and good coffee. The staff were absolutely wonderful, everyone's english was fantastic and they all knew plenty about Rome to give advice from places to dine and drink to transport. The location was the only slight downfall as you're about 20mins from town. Catch the 360 bus to and from the Termini, you want the bus going to Romania street from the centre when coming back, you're the final stop or second to last, the hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Romania stop if you get confused. The 19 Tram will take you to the Vatican (expect 1.5 hr queue in the morning, we paid €35 to a tour group including entry which is usually €15+€7 for headset, and to skip the queue and gained a 2 hour tour with an american speaking italian within the price, definitely pleased we did, this tour group work with the little coffee kiosk in the centre of the square if you want to use them) and after there you can walk to the Colluseum (closes at 3.30 if you want to do this 1st and go the opposite way to us as we missed getting in by 15 mins) with lots of other sights on route. Buy transport tickets from the tobbaconists, or at the hotel desk €1 a trip or €4 a day or €11 for the week. No one ever checked the tickets on the trams or buses but we bought them anyway. The metro shuts at 9pm. The buses are every 15 mins, and the trams are frequent too, running late around midnight, so the location isn't really an issue. DO NOT DO TAXIS IF POSSIBLE. They are expensive, and they add on euros, quickly turning off the metre so you cant see it, or adding several euros if you ask directions anywhere. Italians are so lovely - every stranger we stopped couldn't have gone out of their way more, one couple even missed their bus with no concern so that they would direct us. The waiter of the cafe called the hotel without being asked, and the restaurants are happy for you to use their washrooms without purchasing from them. So no need to ask the taxi driver. Also if you order one, the metre starts from when they take the call - not when you get in. Note - upon departure in all hotels the government have imposed a new tax €6 per person per night which you will need to pay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any friend. Rome is a city to fall in love in and with and this hotel just perfected the trip - I can't wait for another opportunity to go back! Next time I'm requesting a room with a jet bath though as our room didn't include this and we hadn't realised they were available.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect honeymoon nest in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MihaelasiIonut
Reviews.Content: Exquisite good taste, excellent comfort in a very quiet (and safe) area still very well connected to the city main attractions ( 3 min walk to the bus to Termini station, max 10 min walk to the tram to Vatican and the bus to the Historic Center). But probably the best asset of this Hotel is its staff: friendly yet discreet, very open and very courteous, ready to help with every possible request, very efficient . Our special thanks to Sabrina, Loredana , Francesca and Abel and of course to Ibrahim, the maitre d'hotel who made of ( the excellent) breakfast an enjoyable experience to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in Rome Parioli”
Reviews.Author: Harmes
Reviews.Content: Parioli is considered by most Romans to be the best suburb near the centre. In reality the hotel is still very close to Via Veneto and there are two buses that stop just up the road. The area boasts many trees and what is often considered by Romans to be the best gelateria in the whole city. Literally a hole in the wall. I know as I lived in Rome for ten years in the 1980s. The hotel itself is fabulously appointed and no expense has been spared in delivering the best materials both in the rooms and the rest of the hotel. You only have to look at the number of fire hydrants and extinguishers to understand that this is not a hotel that does things by halves. The decoration in the rooms is tasteful and each room has a full size plasma screen. The bathroom was exceptional with acres of marble and a shower unit like no other. Breakfast was tastefully presented and the staff were always corteous and well presented. I have stayed at thousands of hotels but this one must be in my top ten of all time. Its hard to believe that one year ago this place din't even exist but full marks to the owners. They have created a work of art and you will not be disappointed. The only neo is that parking outside can be a bit of a challenge but we didn't experience too many problems with a smaller car. You just have to park "Italian" style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Claudiu61
Reviews.Content: We definitely love this hotel and we will come back soon! Everything was how we expected: outside of the hotel, the staff, the room - beautiful, quiet, clean and with a beautiful perfume. A small advise - more diversity on breakfast food. Thank you 'Tripadvisor' and people which written on it for their good reviews

Reviews.Title: “I would absolutely recommend this hotel to my friends”
Reviews.Author: Femmers
Reviews.Content: When we arrived (by bus no 360, 15-20 minutes from Termini station, 1 euro), we immediately recognized the hotel from the pictures of their website. Luckily, because there was no sign on the outside of the hotel. The girl from the reception was already expecting us. She showed us the room and helped us with the luggage. We booked an executive room, because we wanted a room with a jacuzzi, which was great, after a day of strolling around Rome. The room wasn't really big, but good enough for a few (5) days: enough space to store our luggage, a nice bed, classic furniture, spacious bathroom. The room was very tidy and they cleaned it every time we left the hotel (sometimes the towels were changed twice a day). Breakfast room was downstairs. They offered a wide range of cakes and some bread, yoghurt and fruit. Coffee (try the latte macchiato) and tea was served fresh. The men who worked were really nice. Breakfast was served until 10.30, which was great for us. We spend most of our time in the centre (Colloseum, Vatican, shopping streets) with all the other tourists, but the location of the hotel was also great if we wanted to go to the park (Villa Borghese is a 10 minute walk), the Zoo (in Park Borghese) or when we wanted to go to great restaurants without other tourists. The receptionists at the hotel gave us great tips and made reservations for Molto (international food, great, but a little expensive) and La Pariolina (Italian food, not too fancy). We ate at 9, that's when it becomes more crowded in restaurants. Both restaurants are only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to my friends, because it was clean, the location was great, the people were extremely nice and helpfull and the hotel was small and intimate. Of course there's also a remark: the internet wasn't always working (but that problem can also be caused by my laptop).

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Villa Duse
HotelInfo.Address: Via Alamanno Morelli 1 | Parioli area, 00197 Rome, Italy
